Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Core–shell structure containing the outer imprinted channels layer and MOF-# core

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH = 5.18, T = 25 ℃, initial [SMX] = 20 mg·L-1, SMX volume = 100 mL, PS = 0.188 g, catalysts dosage = 0.05 g
Other Information.Additional Info: The material exhibits specific adsorption via hydrogen bonds, hydrophobic-hydrophobic interaction, π-π stacking, and electrostatic interactions.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH = 5.18, T = 25 ℃, initial [OG] = 20 mg·L-1, OG volume = 100 mL, PS = 0.188 g, catalysts dosage = 0.05 g
Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption occurs due to similar sulfonyl groups and shapes to sulfamethoxazole.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH = 5.18, T = 25 ℃, initial [CPI] = 20 mg·L-1, CPI volume = 100 mL, PS = 0.188 g, catalysts dosage = 0.05 g
Other Information.Additional Info: Unrecognized site and size-exclusion effect prevent adsorption.

Other Information.Test Conditions: pH = 5.18, T = 25 ℃, initial [TET] = 20 mg·L-1, TET volume = 100 mL, PS = 0.188 g, catalysts dosage = 0.05 g
Other Information.Additional Info: Unrecognized site and size-exclusion effect prevent adsorption.

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, EEM fluorescence spectra, LC-MS tests, DFT calculations

Other Information.Additional Info: The material showed robust interference resistance in tap water and polluted river water.
